GenericShrine.synopsis: Dialog with shrine where player can give blessings to gods that do not have their onw statue in Stormshore Tabernacle. Narratively we can say that that money will be spent on getting those gods a space of their own, or another well-intentioned purpose.Only one god will be on the dialog at the same time. And no one will be if a non-cleric character interacts with the shrine and begin the dialog.

TyrShrine.synopsis: Dialog when interactin with the shrine dedicated to Tyrin Stormshore Tabernacle. All players will be able to read some lore about the god. Additionally, if the player is a cleric of Tyr they'll be able to give offerings and pray/communicate with the god to get a blessing.
TyrShrine.how_to_trigger: Interact with the Tyr Shrine in CTY_Main_A 117; 44; -27

SeluneShrine.synopsis: Dialog when interactin with the shrine dedicated to Selune in Stormshore Tabernacle. All players will be able to read some lore about the god. Additionally, if the player is a cleric of Selune they'll be able to give offerings and pray/communicate with the god to get a blessing.
SeluneShrine.how_to_trigger: Interact with the Selune Shrine in CTY_Main_A 100; 44; -27

HelmShrine.synopsis: Dialog when interactin with the shrine dedicated to Helm in Stormshore Tabernacle. All players will be able to read some lore about the god. Additionally, if the player is a cleric of Helm, they'll be able to give offerings and pray/communicate with the god to get a blessing.
HelmShrine.how_to_trigger: Interact with the Helm Shrine in CTY_Main_A 117; 44; -27

PriestReactStealAttempt.synopsis: The Tabernacle priest's reaction when you steal from a divine coffer.

TempleGuardian_ReactStealAction.synopsis: One liner for when players steal something from the offering chests in Stormshore Tabernacle.
TempleGuardian_ReactStealAction.how_to_trigger: Steal something from the offering chests with the temple guardan close enough.CTY_Main_A aprox 107; 45; -22

PAD_PuttingItemsInChest.synopsis: When players put items or gold in the chest in Stormshore Tabernacle, this AD will be played: gods didn't like that someone touch their sacred chests.
PAD_PuttingItemsInChest.how_to_trigger: Add items or gold into S_LOW_TyrChest, S_LOW_SeluneChest, S_LOW_MystraChest, S_LOW_HelmChest, S_LOW_GenericGodChest

PAD_RespectsToMystra.synopsis: Gale notices Mystra's statue in the Stormshore Tabernacle. There's some player interactivity if they choose  to interact on whether this ends up being an act of defiance/prayer/rejection,
PAD_RespectsToMystra.how_to_trigger: Enter in S_LOW_StormshoreTabernacle_VB_RespectsToMystra_277ab143-0e43-4046-951b-2880c628ca36 with Gale in the party.

MystraShrine.synopsis: Dialog when interactin with the shrine dedicated to Mystra in Stormshore Tabernacle. All players will be able to read some lore about the god. Additionally, if the player is a cleric of Mystra they'll be able to give offerings and pray/communicate with the god to get a blessing.
MystraShrine.how_to_trigger: Interact with the Mystra Shrine in CTY_Main_A 100; 44; -19

TempleGuardian.synopsis: Dialog between players and the temple guardian, a halfling vicar in Stormshore Tabernacle. If the player is a cleric of a particular god, the statue will tell the player that they are about to be judged by their deity. This dialog should give some hints to the fact that things could go badly if they acted differently from what the god defends, but should proceed to the judgement anyways.
TempleGuardian.how_to_trigger: Interact with central altar in Stormshore TabernacleLocation: CTY_Main_A 109; 45; -12

AD_TempleGuardian_Pray.synopsis: In the stormshore tabernacle, as part of his behaviour, the temple guardian will pray. The guardian has no god at the moment, but we can make him to pray to "all gods" or to the god that fits more with the situation.The praying point is in front of the generic shrine, but can be moved to the other ones without problem.
AD_TempleGuardian_Pray.how_to_trigger: The character S_LOW_TempleGuardian_32ec6ad3-c085-4fc5-943b-e2e3a05d9f2b will move to the point (TRIGGER)S_LOW_StormshoreTabernacle_PrayPoint_9afca468-b88c-4355-b34d-ea858ed14eaf steer to the shrine S_LOW_GenericGodStatue_d71704b6-24b6-46b7-982c-89acb3edfc20 and pray.

GenericShrine_19.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_19.text: *You have defiled a holy place. The gods will speak to you no more.*

GenericShrine_71.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_71.text: *This altar isn't dedicated to a single god, but instead acts as a conduit to many.*

GenericShrine_123.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_123.text: *Your god is one of many, and in this place you sense a spark of its mighty divine flame.*

GenericShrine_31.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_31.text: *As a cleric, you may sacrifice wealth to your deity and expect to receive a boon.*

GenericShrine_40.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_40.text: Think of Bhaal, think of blood.

GenericShrine_1.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_1.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Bahamut.

GenericShrine_101.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_101.text: *Your soul opens to their divine power.*

GenericShrine_70.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_70.text: *Father claws into your heart and stops it for a single moment. As you begin to fear for your life, you know his love is close.*

GenericShrine_106.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_106.text: *Your Father's power stops your heart for one horrible, terrible moment, then starts it again with the lash of duty.*

GenericShrine_29.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_29.text: *Warmth suffuses your body from within as you feel the righteous will of Bahamut, Grandfather of Dragons.*

GenericShrine_74.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_74.text: *Your body and soul shiver with delight as you receive the blessing of Corellon, First of the Seldarine.*

GenericShrine_75.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_75.text: *The blood in your veins beats to the rhythms of Eilistraee as the Dark Dancer's blessing strums you like a lyre.*

GenericShrine_22.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_22.text: *Glitterbright cleric, feel your wits sharpen and muscles harden under the blessing of Garl the Watchful Protector.*

GenericShrine_59.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_59.text: *Your heart swells with fury and defiance as the iron will of Gruumsh One-Eye infuses you with orcish power! Repay his blessing with blood!*

GenericShrine_122.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_122.text: *Ilmater, the One Who Endures, gently imbues you with the resolve and resignation to persevere through the trials to come.*

GenericShrine_28.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_28.text: *Doomguide of Kelemvor, receive His blessing: the death of fear, anxiety, and hesitation. For all must die and come to judgement.*

GenericShrine_55.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_55.text: *Accept Laduguer's blessing of bitter resentment! Count your grievances and draw strength therefrom, for in malice there is power.*

GenericShrine_100.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_100.text: *Be of good cheer, for Lathander the Morninglord blesses you with vigour and joy! 'In the dawn, the way is clear.'*

GenericShrine_81.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_81.text: *You are blessed by Lolth, and her spiderlings of cruelty, lust, and ambition seem to hatch in your chest and skitter along your nerves.*

GenericShrine_136.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_136.text: *Walker, you are blessed by Mielikki, and even here among the stones of the city you smell the fragrance of the forest and feel moss beneath your feet.*

GenericShrine_20.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_20.text: *Moradin seems to hammer your body and soul into a fine-tempered tool wrought to work the will of the Forger. So be it!*

GenericShrine_11.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_11.text: *Oghma the Wise blesses you, and your doubts and fears are replaced by knowledge and insight. Go forth and be judicious.*

GenericShrine_149.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_149.text: *The blessing of Talos empowers you with the surging fury of storm! Fear not, for none can stand against you.*

GenericShrine_145.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_145.text: *Tempus, the Lord of Honourable Battle, calls upon you to confront and defeat your enemies, and blesses you with the will to victory!*

GenericShrine_99.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_99.text: *Blessed by Tiamat, the flame of the Dragon Queen seems to roar in your breast like fire in a furnace. Let your enemies beware!*

GenericShrine_26.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_26.text: *As Tymora smiles upon you, your fortune and wit are burnished and shine as bright as a new gold coin.*

GenericShrine_65.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_65.text: *Blessed Child of Yondalla, accept her protection and extend her blessing to all who need guidance and guarding.*

GenericShrine_156.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_156.text: *The Lady of Loss blesses you - be troubled by neither memory nor misgiving.*

GenericShrine_33.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_33.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Corellon.

GenericShrine_148.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_148.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Eilistraee.

GenericShrine_21.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_21.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Garl Glittergold.

GenericShrine_60.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_60.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Gruumsh.

GenericShrine_93.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_93.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Ilmater.

GenericShrine_97.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_97.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Kelemvor.

GenericShrine_131.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_131.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Laduguer.

GenericShrine_137.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_137.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Lathander.

GenericShrine_82.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_82.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Lolth.

GenericShrine_90.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_90.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Mielikki.

GenericShrine_125.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_125.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Moradin.

GenericShrine_127.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_127.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Oghma.

GenericShrine_120.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_120.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Talos.

GenericShrine_83.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_83.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Tempus.

GenericShrine_38.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_38.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Tiamat.

GenericShrine_36.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_36.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Tymora.

GenericShrine_134.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_134.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Yondalla.

GenericShrine_25.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_25.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Shar.

GenericShrine_39.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_39.text: Read what is inscribed on the altar.

GenericShrine_91.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_91.text: *It reads: 'Show your devotion with an offering in your god's name. Blessings may follow.'*

GenericShrine_154.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_154.text: *You offer your paltry gold to the void, like a child at the sweet shop.*

GenericShrine_112.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_112.text: *There is no response, and you know why - Bhaal will accept the world from you, and nothing less.*

GenericShrine_16.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_16.text: Pay homage and honour to the gods of light and justice.

GenericShrine_3.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_3.text: *The gods are ready to receive your joyful donation.*

GenericShrine_87.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_87.text: Make an offering to Bahamut, the dragon god of justice.

GenericShrine_72.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_72.text: Make an offering to Corellon the Protector, Creator of the Elves.

GenericShrine_2.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_2.text: Make an offering to Eilistraee, the Dancing Goddess of beauty and freedom.

GenericShrine_80.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_80.text: Make an offering to Garl Glittergold, the bright and clever Father of All Gnomes.

GenericShrine_50.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_50.text: Make an offering to Ilmater, the One Who Endures, god of the oppressed and persecuted.

GenericShrine_0.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_0.text: Make an offering to Lathander the Morninglord, god of vitality, of hope, and of beginnings.

GenericShrine_155.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_155.text: Make an offering to Mielikki, the Lady of the Forest and Supreme Ranger.

GenericShrine_52.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_52.text: Make an offering to Moradin the Soul Forger, All-Father of the Dwarves.

GenericShrine_68.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_68.text: Make an offering to Yondalla the Blessed, Matriarch of the Halflings.

GenericShrine_51.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_51.text: Choose from another group of deities.

GenericShrine_119.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_119.text: Seek the wisdom and judgement of the gods of balance and ambiguity.

GenericShrine_41.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_41.text: *The gods are ready to receive your donation.*

GenericShrine_7.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_7.text: Make an offering to Kelemvor the Great Guide, Lord of the Dead.

GenericShrine_111.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_111.text: Make an offering to Oghma, Lord of Knowledge and Patron of Bards.

GenericShrine_84.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_84.text: Make an offering to Tempus, God  of War and Lord of Honourable Battle.

GenericShrine_53.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_53.text: Make an offering to Tymora, the Bright Smiling Lady of Luck.

GenericShrine_151.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_151.text: Seek power and self-justification from the gods of greed and darkness.

GenericShrine_103.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_103.text: *The gods are ready to receive your sacrifice.*

GenericShrine_18.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_18.text: Make an offering to Gruumsh One-Eye, He Who Watches, God of the Orcs.

GenericShrine_47.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_47.text: Make an offering to Laduguer the Exile, Deity of the Duergar.

GenericShrine_92.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_92.text: Make an offering to Lolth, the Weaver of Destiny and Queen of Spiders and Darkness.

GenericShrine_116.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_116.text: Make an offering to Talos the Storm Lord, God of Fury and Destruction.

GenericShrine_12.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_12.text: Make an offering to Tiamat, Dragon Queen of Chaos and Avarice.

GenericShrine_139.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_139.text: *The amount you've offered proves your piety and devotion. You may now pray here once a day for a divine blessing.*

GenericShrine_10.speaker: Narrator
GenericShrine_10.text: *Your offering is accepted, but more evidence of devotion is required.*

GenericShrine_135.speaker: Player
GenericShrine_135.text: Make an offering to Shar, Dark Lady of Loss and Mistress of the Night.

TyrShrine_4.speaker: Narrator
TyrShrine_4.text: *As the God of Justice, Tyr frowns upon theft from his sacred altar. It would be wise to consider other ways of filling your purse.*

TyrShrine_7.speaker: Narrator
TyrShrine_7.text: *You see an altar dedicated to Tyr.*

TyrShrine_20.speaker: Narrator
TyrShrine_20.text: *The Blind God hears your approach to his altar, and Tyr welcomes your presence.*

TyrShrine_25.speaker: Player
TyrShrine_25.text: Read what is inscribed on the altar.

TyrShrine_21.speaker: Narrator
TyrShrine_21.text: *Tyr, the Blind God, offers justice to all, innocent and malefactor alike. The law dictates what is right, be that reward or retribution.*

TyrShrine_16.speaker: Narrator
TyrShrine_16.text: *His unseeing eyes are a testament to the lawful life he lived, and what it cost him. Make a sacrifice out of your own pocket, and you may yet be blessed.*

TyrShrine_9.speaker: Narrator
TyrShrine_9.text: *Your knowledge of Religion isn't extensive enough to tell you more.*

TyrShrine_13.speaker: Narrator
TyrShrine_13.text: *The amount you've offered proves your faith and devotion. You may now pray here once a day for a divine blessing.*

TyrShrine_0.speaker: Narrator
TyrShrine_0.text: *Your offering is accepted, but more evidence of devotion is required.*

TyrShrine_23.speaker: Player
TyrShrine_23.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Tyr.

TyrShrine_5.speaker: Narrator
TyrShrine_5.text: Show reverence before your deity and open your soul to their divine power.

TyrShrine_6.speaker: Narrator
TyrShrine_6.text: *Tyr blesses you with the judgement to know right from wrong and the strength to mete out retribution for injustice.*

SeluneShrine_7.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_7.text: *You feel the chill gaze of the Moonmaiden upon you. Selûne welcomes you.*

SeluneShrine_21.speaker: Player
SeluneShrine_21.text: Read that which is inscribed upon the altar.

SeluneShrine_13.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_13.text: *An inscription reads: 'Let all who worship the changing tides of life and knowledge feel the blessings of Selûne'*

SeluneShrine_11.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_11.text: *Trust in the purity of my light, see the constancy in its inconstancy, and you will be guided aright.*

SeluneShrine_26.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_26.text: *As a Moonbathed cleric, this is your moment to bask in her lunar light, and imbue your spirit with her majesty and grace.*

SeluneShrine_6.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_6.text: *Goddess of the moon and stars, her words and light have long helped wanderers to find their way. Perhaps it could help you, too.*

SeluneShrine_10.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_10.text: *Your scholarship of Religion tells you no more.*

SeluneShrine_1.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_1.text: *The amount you've offered proves your faith and devotion. You may now pray here once a day for a divine blessing.*

SeluneShrine_16.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_16.text: *Your offering is accepted, but more evidence of devotion is required.*

SeluneShrine_23.speaker: Player
SeluneShrine_23.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Selûne.

SeluneShrine_14.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_14.text: Show reverence before your deity and open your soul to their divine power.

SeluneShrine_25.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_25.text: *The cold white light of Selûne fills you with majestic wisdom and grace. Shine forth as the Moonmaiden shines.*

SeluneShrine_17.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_17.text: *You feel a chill - plundering this altar will surely anger Selûne the Moonmaiden. Best to leave well enough alone.*

SeluneShrine_24.speaker: Narrator
SeluneShrine_24.text: *You see an altar dedicated to Selûne.*

HelmShrine_13.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_13.text: *You see an altar dedicated to Helm the Vigilant.*

HelmShrine_16.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_16.text: *Helm the Vigilant sees your unlawful plunder of His altar - and his vengeance is terrible. It would be best to leave well enough alone.*

HelmShrine_20.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_20.text: *You feel the gaze of Helm the Vigilant, who welcomes the faithful to his altar.*

HelmShrine_7.speaker: Player
HelmShrine_7.text: Read the inscription on the altar.

HelmShrine_0.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_0.text: *Helm the Watcher is a guardian god dedicated to the preservation of order. Many turn to him in troubled times.*

HelmShrine_11.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_11.text: *As a Vicarph, a cleric of Helm, if your donation evokes a blessing, you'll feel more stern and alert than ever.*

HelmShrine_5.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_5.text: *Make your donation to him and you'll likely feel more vigilant, more resilient to the unexpected.*

HelmShrine_15.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_15.text: *Your knowledge of Religion tells you nothing more about the worship of Helm.*

HelmShrine_4.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_4.text: *The amount you've offered proves your faith and devotion. You may now pray here once a day for a divine blessing.*

HelmShrine_9.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_9.text: *Your offering is accepted, but more evidence of devotion is required.*

HelmShrine_6.speaker: Player
HelmShrine_6.text: Beseech a blessing from your deity, Helm.

HelmShrine_12.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_12.text: Show reverence before your deity and open your soul to their divine power.

HelmShrine_25.speaker: Narrator
HelmShrine_25.text: *You are blessed by Helm's fierce vigilance, and feel stern and alert. Praise Helm!*

PriestReactStealAttempt_0.speaker: bd240ab2-013c-4160-b079-61edf84468a9
PriestReactStealAttempt_0.text: Hey, hands off that sacred offering chest! Those donations are consecrated to the gods - touch them at your peril.

PriestReactStealAttempt_1.speaker: bd240ab2-013c-4160-b079-61edf84468a9
PriestReactStealAttempt_1.text: Beware of blasphemy! Nothing good comes from angering the gods.

TempleGuardian_ReactStealAction_0.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_ReactStealAction_0.text: Again you commit blasphemous theft in this holy tabernacle? Have you learned nothing?

TempleGuardian_ReactStealAction_1.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_ReactStealAction_1.text: You thought it wise to steal from the gods? A curse be upon you!

PAD_PuttingItemsInChest_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PuttingItemsInChest_0.text: Best not to touch the chest of offerings other mortals have left to their gods. But I can use the altar to pray.

PAD_RespectsToMystra_1.speaker: Player
PAD_RespectsToMystra_1.text: Mystra's likeness... It's been some time since I stood before her in a place like this...

PAD_RespectsToMystra_2.speaker: Player
PAD_RespectsToMystra_2.text: Ah, there's a shrine to Lolth in the corner there. Excuse me while I spit on it.
PAD_RespectsToMystra_2.context: NodeContext: SH: Abandoned shar and loyal to shar variants

MystraShrine_0.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_0.text: *Mystra has already spoken. There is nothing else for you here.*

MystraShrine_5.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_5.text: *Mystra, Goddess of Magic, is offended that you would rob her altar. Her disapproval hovers heavily around you - best to keep your hands to yourself.*

MystraShrine_22.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_22.text: *Mystra's idol stands before you, as silent as the goddess herself.*

MystraShrine_2.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_2.text: *You're not sure what you expected. After all, she's not deigned to speak with you for some time.*

MystraShrine_29.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_29.text: *If your refusal to detonate the orb did not get her attention, perhaps pursuing the crown will. But until then, it seems you are on your own.*

MystraShrine_24.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_24.text: *You see an altar dedicated to Mystra.*

MystraShrine_31.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_31.text: *Mystra is attentive - the Lady of Magic welcomes your presence.*

MystraShrine_13.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_13.text: Whatever you want with this idol, I'd prefer we make it quick. I'm not sure I'm comfortable catching Mystra's eye, even if it is made of stone.

MystraShrine_18.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_18.text: You don't want to make an offering? A prayer of some kind?

MystraShrine_14.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_14.text: Trust me - it will take a lot more than a few gold pieces and some fervent thoughts to convince Mystra to break her silence. On my account, at least.

MystraShrine_16.speaker: Gale
MystraShrine_16.text: Commune with her as you see fit. I've no wish to stand between you and any inspiration she might deign to offer.

MystraShrine_11.speaker: Player
MystraShrine_11.text: Read the words inscribed on the altar.

MystraShrine_15.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_15.text: *Mystra, Mother of All Magic, is the patron of wizards, and often called upon by other spellcasters as well. She's said to be a jealous goddess.*

MystraShrine_28.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_28.text: *As her cleric, even standing in her statue's presence makes you feel more sensitive to the Weave, and to her power.*

MystraShrine_30.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_30.text: *Even though you do not follow her, you feel her power resonating from the statue. She is the One True Spell at the heart of all spells. The Weave could not be in better hands.*

MystraShrine_27.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_27.text: *Your studies of Religion don't suffice to tell you more.*

MystraShrine_7.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_7.text: *The amount you've offered proves your faith and devotion. You may now pray here once a day for a divine blessing.*

MystraShrine_10.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_10.text: *Your offering is accepted, but more evidence of devotion is required.*

MystraShrine_21.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_21.text: Show reverence before your deity and open your soul to their divine power.

MystraShrine_26.speaker: Narrator
MystraShrine_26.text: *The Mistress of Magic blesses you with an enhanced attunement to the Weave. Praise her!*

TempleGuardian_1.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_1.text: I can smell the heady smoke of the Dwarffather's forge all around you, cleric. Be welcome.

TempleGuardian_32.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_32.text: You have come far, I perceive. How may I serve you this day?

TempleGuardian_46.speaker: Player
TempleGuardian_46.text: How did you know who I was?

TempleGuardian_21.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_21.text: My purpose is to connect every soul with their divine patron. How could I do that if I couldn't distinguish what deities they serve?

TempleGuardian_37.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_37.text: I am Vicar Humbletoes, guardian of the Stormshore Tabernacle. I keep the peace in this sacred place and guide those in need.

TempleGuardian_0.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_0.text: Here, clerics may commune with their gods - and even hear their responses, if they are so favoured.

TempleGuardian_47.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_47.text: I am also granted the power to provide holy resurrection through sales of revivification scrolls.

TempleGuardian_33.speaker: Player
TempleGuardian_33.text: Are holy items available here for purchase?

TempleGuardian_30.speaker: Player
TempleGuardian_30.text: Are you still offering blessed items for sale?

TempleGuardian_28.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_28.text: Of course, my child - within limits. Behold my wares.

TempleGuardian_40.speaker: Narrator
TempleGuardian_40.text: *News of your good deeds has travelled fast. The merchant is all too happy to extend a certain generosity towards you, where the price of goods is concerned.*

TempleGuardian_41.speaker: Narrator
TempleGuardian_41.text: *Your notoriety precedes you. Prices have been moderated to reflect your less than welcome presence in the city.*

TempleGuardian_18.speaker: Player
TempleGuardian_18.text: I feel my god's roiling darkness in this place - why?

TempleGuardian_15.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_15.text: Hah - that is no surprise, holy one. You have entered the Stormshore Tabernacle.

TempleGuardian_2.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_2.text: I have nothing to say to you, defiler. May the gods punish you for your transgressions against this sacred site.

TempleGuardian_3.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_3.text: It is unfortunate we live in times of battle - but I'm glad to see the Lord of War's followers grace our lowly tabernacle. Be welcome.

TempleGuardian_4.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_4.text: You are bathed in the cool gleam of moonlight. You must be a follower of Selûne.

TempleGuardian_5.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_5.text: One of the Smiling Lady's faithful graces our doorstep - we are lucky indeed. Be welcome, cleric.

TempleGuardian_6.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_6.text: You have the hawk eyes of a vigilant predator. Welcome, cleric of Helm.

TempleGuardian_7.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_7.text: Faithless creatures seldom cross our threshold, oathbreaker.

TempleGuardian_8.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_8.text: All faithful are bid entrance here, even those who serve the Queen of Chaos. Be welcome.

TempleGuardian_9.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_9.text: Fear and cruelty enter the Tabernacle. All devotion has its place here, even those who worship Lolth.

TempleGuardian_12.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_12.text: I feel the Platinum Dragon shining through you, cleric. Be welcome.

TempleGuardian_13.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_13.text: The smell of pine, the crunch of elder leaves. Be welcome, faithful of the Forest Queen.

TempleGuardian_14.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_14.text: Shar's faithful rarely darken our doors - but all devotion has its place here. Be welcome.

TempleGuardian_16.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_16.text: Allow me to repay the generosity of your patron, Yondalla. Be welcome, cleric.

TempleGuardian_17.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_17.text: We are a long way from the battlefield, Gruumsh-sworn. Step lightly, but know you are welcome here.

TempleGuardian_19.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_19.text: Ah - the merry step of a Fey faithful on our tabernacle's doorstep. Be welcome, cleric of the First Seldarine.

TempleGuardian_20.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_20.text: Be welcome, cleric of Laduguer. All faithful are accepted here, no matter their deity's proclivities.

TempleGuardian_22.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_22.text: You have a scent of the Weave about you. I perceive you're a cleric of Mystra.

TempleGuardian_23.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_23.text: The mercy and compassion that radiate from a cleric of Ilmater are unmistakable. Welcome.

TempleGuardian_24.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_24.text: Many misunderstand the Lord of Death - but I am not one of them. Be welcome here, cleric of Kelemvor.

TempleGuardian_25.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_25.text: Your patron may not enjoy you shopping around the divine, warlock, it bothers me none. Be welcome, child of faith.

TempleGuardian_26.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_26.text: A roiling storm lies beneath your countenance. Welcome, faithful of the Destroyer.

TempleGuardian_29.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_29.text: A beam of morning sun enters - be welcome, cleric of Lathander.

TempleGuardian_31.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_31.text: Your very presence groans with the weight of Oghma's knowledge. Be welcome, learned one.

TempleGuardian_35.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_35.text: Well met, Oathsworn. Your faith may not be orthodox, but it is still welcome here.

TempleGuardian_38.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_38.text: Your eyes glow with fervor of one who seeks justice. You must be a priest of Tyr.

TempleGuardian_39.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_39.text: A cleric of Eilistraee enters the Tabernacle, and my heart lifts with song. Be welcome.

TempleGuardian_42.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_42.text: My, you are a long way from the Lich Queen's watchful gaze, cleric. I hope you can find some solace here, at least.

TempleGuardian_43.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_43.text: Greetings, child of faith. Be welcome to the Stormshore Tabernacle.

TempleGuardian_45.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
TempleGuardian_45.text: I see the mirthful chuckle of Garl Glittergold in those eyes of yours. Be welcome, cleric.

AD_TempleGuardian_Pray_2.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
AD_TempleGuardian_Pray_2.text: Divine protectors of Baldur's Gate, hear this humble plea.

AD_TempleGuardian_Pray_1.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
AD_TempleGuardian_Pray_1.text: Shield our people from the depredations of the Absolute heretics.

AD_TempleGuardian_Pray_0.speaker: Vicar Humbletoes
AD_TempleGuardian_Pray_0.text: Bless them with the strength to endure and the courage to resist. So may it be.
